paper.title: The Modal Logic of Programs
paper.venue: International Colloquium on Automata, Languages and Programming
paper.abstract: We explore the general framework of Modal Logic and its applicability to program reasoning. We relate the basic concepts of Modal Logic to the programming environment: the concept of "world" corresponds to a program state, and the concept of "accessibility relation" corresponds to the relation of derivability between states during execution. Thus we adopt the Temporal interpretation of Modal Logic. The variety of program properties expressible within the modal formalism is demonstrated.
